result.execSummary:
The defendant Greg M. Porter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Jackson County case 13CF48 - Count 1

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Must comply with any other programming recommendations of your agent.  Must submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.  There is no jail credit on this case.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: A civil judgment has been entered against you for the unpaid Court ordered financial obligations.
Sentenced to 362 days jail with credit for time served of 362 days.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Greg M. Porter
Current: 916  5th Ave S, La Crosse, WI 54601 United States  (Effective: 12-02-2016)
Prior: PO Box 367, Black River Falls, WI 54615
From DOC with Revocation Order and Warrant/Summary
Received from Judge Feltes

Defendant appears in person in custody with counsel SPD Carly Sebion. Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Revocation is on the single count in the case.  No changes or corrections noted to the ROAW. No victims in this matter.  The State states he already has 362 days already as sentence credit and recommends a 2 years initial confinement in state prison with ERP and 2 years extended supervision with all conditions be geared toward maintaining sobriety, employment, and for programming.  State stipulates to the sentence credit of 362.  SPD Carly Sebion makes her recommendation to the State - he is still on probation on another case for another year and a half so he is still getting programming and under conditions through DOC.  He needs mental health and grief counseling.  He's already had in-patient treatment at MSDF.  Requests the Court to follow the DOC recommendation of time served of 1 year in county jail; and he has served more than that already.  Defendant exercises his right to allocution.  Court orders 362 days in county jail with credit for time served. May be released today.  Civil judgment for $518 is entered.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 2, 2016 at 11:30 am.
DNA submission form.
from JASO.  Notice of time served on commitment order (no commutment ever issued)

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant appeared in custody from Jackson County Jail with counsel SPD Carly Sebion.  DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  There are joint recommendations for counts/cases scheduled today.  Sentencing after revocation cases 12CM270 & 12CM297there is a joint recommendation of 90 days jail with credit for 249 days jail; 12CM355 there is a joint recommendation of 9 months jail with credit for 249 days jail; 13CF18 - Count 3 there is a joint recommendation of 6 months jail with credit for 90 days served; 13CF48 there is a joint recommendation of 6 months jail with credit for 135 days served.  Judge accepted and followed the joint recommendation and sentenced per recommendation.  Defendant is to pay court costs and fines and may request a payment plan within 60 days.  Failure to pay will result in a commitment order being issued for 1 day jail for each $40 left unpaid on each case.  All sentences are to run concurrent.  13CF48 - Count 1 and 15CF35 there is a joint recommendation for 3 years probation with conditions.  DPA was previously revoked on Count 1 in 13CF48.  Defendant pleads NC to Count 1 in 15CF35.  Judge reviews charges/penalties/elements/rights with defendant.  Felony warning given.  Court finds the defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently wavies his rights and entered his plea and finds him guilty on both cases/counts.  Court adopts the joint recommendation and places defendant on 3 years probation concurrent with the following conditions:  Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Must pay the costs on both cases plus a DNA surcharge and submit a sample in 15CF35.  Judge advises of right to expungment of DNA.  No jail credit granted on these 2 cases/counts.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 06-10-2015 09:00 am

DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Attorney Sebion appeared in court.  Case was adjourned to 2:45 today.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located. Defendant is to contact State Public Defender's Office and re-apply.
